nodes.bodyText: Instead of passing the TextView, keep it here, and then change the return of the displayEnvironmentInfo() to a String. If you get the displayEnvironmentInfo() into a ~simple text factory, it will be east to add a unit test over it, too.

I removed the TextView parameter from displayEnvironmentInfo() (setting the text of the TextView in onCreateView instead), but I set the return type for displayEnvironmentInfo() to a SpannableStringBuilder instead of a String in order to retain the styling applied to the Spannables appended to the SpannableStringBuilder.

Even though they would be short helper methods -- there is an opporrunity here to create some semantically-named ones. You can probably get this line to like setBold(pluginIntoTitle) or something? Same general approach applies to each line in this method where your intention is to setVisualStylingOfSomeKind(...).
Oh niiicee. This cleaned up nicely.
